channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sewage is coming up at the back of 133-198 Lincoln Court ( The North Block) and there is sewage in the front garden from the manhole next to the garage in the grass., 8th October
item.description:
There is sewage flooding out of the drains in the rear and front garden of the block. This is a serious health hazard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots making pavement unsafe., 8th October
item.description:
159 Camberwell Grove pavement. Tree roots form a high sideways sloping mound ending in the garden path of 159 as it is straight opposite It is dangerous or impassable for buggies. wheel chair or people with disabilities. To step into the road is also unsafe. The pavement outside 142 opposite is also too narrow for a double buggies. So there is no safe walking route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 161, Camberwell Grove, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bulb not working for the past 8 months and has been reported., 8th October
item.description:
Light bulb on this pole is not working and it is has been reported several times nothing is done by the council and Peabody. It is always dark at night and a potential crime spot without light. Area not safe at night. Please help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sewell Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A big 5feet fridge and a few household rubbish left under the tree., 8th October
item.description:
A 5 feet fridge dumped and some few household materials dumped under the tree at Owen close. By the 2nd tree on the left on entering Owen Close

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Owen Close, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Outside 111 and 113 Canfield, 8th October
item.description:
The severity of vibrations continues to increase Prior to G Network's excavation and the subsequent road repairs, our property experienced no such issues with passing buses. The problem is directly attributable to the inadequate road repairs following the cable installation works. Request for Action Given the serious and escalating nature of this issue, I urgently request that Camden Council: Conduct an immediate inspection of the road defect outside my property Arrange for a structural survey to assess any damage to my property and surrounding homes Undertake comprehensive repairs to properly reinstate the road to its previous condition Provide a timeline for remedial works Confirm liability arrangements for any structural damage caused I would appreciate written acknowledgement of this complaint within 10 working days please, along with details of how Camden Council intends to address this urgent matter. I am gravely concerned that without prompt intervention, irreversible structural damage will occur, potentially compromising the safety and stability of my home and those of my neighbours. I trust you will treat this matter with the urgency it warrants. I am available to discuss this matter further and to facilitate site inspections at your earliest convenience. Please do not hesitate to contact me on the details provided above. I look forward to your prompt response. Yours faithfully, Alexander Dawood
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Canfield Gardens, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 8th October

item.title: Junction of Shaftesbury avenue / mercer street, 8th October
item.description:
The no right turn sign for the phobited no right turn from Shaftesbury avenue into mercer street Travelling northbound is in the wrong position Cars are turning right as the sign is on the opposite side of the road where car drivers possibly would not see it it in their immmediate view No doubt the council is issuing fines which is illegal and no doubt contrary to the fact itâ€™s being used as a cash cow The sign should be placed on the east pavement where it can be seen or on the crossing warning drivers This in itself is a failure by the council to provide proper signage If nothing gets done I feel this will be one for the press to publish
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Giles Passage, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 14, 8th October
item.description:

item.title: Road disintegrating 1 week after repair, 8th October
item.description:
York Road was closed for repairs to the road surface, but only a week after reopening, the repaired area and adjacent road surface is disintegrating as in the picture. Maybe the contractors should be sent back to do the job properly at their own cost.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): York Road, New Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In correct positions of street signage to enforce a no right turn, 8th October
item.description:
The street sign for a no right turn is in the wrong position on Shaftesbury avenue travelling northbound To enforce a no right turn into mercer street Vehicles travelling northbound are not going to see the no right sign Which is on the opposite side of the road No doubt the council is enjoying making this junction a cash cow as motorists unless aware are not going to see it This in itself is an illegal enforcement as the signs are not in the Correct position Ideally they need to be in the crossing or on the junction on the east side Warming cars not to turn right I would be interested to hear your views about this issue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Long Acre, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big rubbish bags dumped on the side of the pavement, 8th October
item.description:
These look like trade materials bags, they are full of rubbish. This is a prime location for recurring fly tipping. Along the entire estate. Some surveillance cameras and better police enforcement would help tackling the concerning trend of fly tipping. Unfortunately Itâ€™s becoming a regular issue across Plumstead

item.title: All kinds of garbage in front of the entrance to the property, 8th October
item.description:
Whenever someone wants to throw away any kind of trashâ€”irons, bed frames, chairs, towels, hair dryers, etc.â€”they leave it at the entrance, and it's very unpleasant because they bring and throw away more and more things, even garbage bags. This happens all the time. Then the foxes tear up those bags or whatever they leave behind, and it spills all over the entrance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Bellenden Road, Peckham, London
